availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Lusby (Lexington, Kentucky, marshal and Fayette County Jailer)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, marshal and Fayette County Jailer. Married to Matilda B. Lusby. Father of Thomas E. Lusby, Letcher Lusby, William S. Lusby, Henry Lusby, Walter Lusby, and Harrod Lusby. Cabinet maker in Fayetter County, Kentucky, in 1850. City marshal in Lexington in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Jailer of the Fayette County Court in 1863.

ab.bibl: KYR-0001-029-0546. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 131. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 1, p. 377. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 1, p. 51. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 10. “William Henry Lusby,” Find A Grave, "William Henry Lusby (1817 - 1886)," Memorial #21632606, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=21632606 (accessed May 19, 2017).
